page.title: 02OPENCAST MINING
page.content:
{ Opencast Mining in Atherton { This started in June 1981 and concluded in December 1984. The site situated at the bottom of Miller's Lane covers 70 hectares and yielded 339 thousand tonnes of coal. In the 1950's coal was mined at Beefold, Crabfold and Miller's Lane pits and at that time a railway line, now disused crossed the area. Coal was under this line and N.C.B. (National Coal Board) wanted to remove it. Draglines lifted the coal which was taken along the railway line over Leigh Road to Wigan Road and on to Bickershaw Colliery.
